name: Deep Learning Research Engineer (image editing and synthesis with neural networks)
description:
We at Samsung AI Center are looking for a Deep Learning Research Engineer for the project on image editing and synthesis with neural networks.

Our primary focus is the task of image and video editing and generation, with topics including generative modeling (GANs and beyond), neural rendering, semantic image manipulation, image and video generation and editing. We are working on applied research, and the outcomes of our work include proof-of-concept applications, research papers on top conferences, and patent applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Making research to develop new computer vision algorithms, primarily based on deep learning
  • Implementing algorithms in Python, using various frameworks and libraries, following the specified APIs for code integration with other modules
  • Writing papers for the world's leading computer vision conferences
  • Preparation of materials for patent applications
  • Contributing to Proofs-of-Concepts and demo applications
  • Writing technical reports and presenting results to colleagues or a broader audience

Requirements:

  • 3+ years in computer vision algorithms development
  • 2+ years of experience in neural networks implementation, training, and debugging
  • Familiarity with modern trends and latest achievements in the field
  • Strong programming skills (Python) and knowledge of standard algorithms and data structures
  • Ability to quickly read a scientific paper and understand its main ideas and results

As a plus:

  • Publications at CV/ML conferences
  • Competitive ML achievements, e.g. Kaggle
  • Experience in image generation, GANs, unsupervised or weakly supervised learning
  • Experience in 3D and photogrammetric pipelines and 3D modeling, animation, and rendering tools like Blender, Unreal Engine 4, COLMAP, Reality Capture, etc.
  • Experience in contribution to IT products and services
  • Experience in multi-GPU model training using GPU clouds
  • Experience in Android development & optimization of NN for mobile

Work conditions:

  • Great team with a track record of papers on top conferences
  • Challenging research & engineering tasks at the cutting edge of the modern computer vision
  • Cozy modern office in 2 minutes from Belorusskaya Circle Line
  • Competitive salary
  • Corporate lunches
  • Medical and life insurance.
  • 7 days of paid sick leaves (without sick leave certificate)
  • Corporate discount on company goods
  • Flexible working time
  • Full compliance with Russian Labor Code
  • Fitness room, shower, partial fitness compensation
  • The company compensates relocation and interview expenses

About us:

Multimodal Data Analysis Lab’s main target is pushing the boundaries of advanced image manipulation techniques. We have several completed projects, such as:

  • (CVPR 2020 Oral) "High-Resolution Daytime Translation Without Domain Labels" - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xhlC7aZd9Ks
  • (ECCV 2020) "DeepLandscape: Adversarial Modeling of Landscape Videos" - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2CoQRf5qXWY
  • (CVPR 2021 Oral) “Image Generators with Conditionally-Independent Pixel Synthesis” (State of the Art on Image Generation on LSUN Churches) - https://github.com/saic-mdal/CIPS

You can find more info on our lab’s GitHub with the code for our published papers: https://github.com/saic-mdal/

About Samsung AI Center:

  • Samsung AI Center – Moscow had been founded in 2018
  • We are sitting in White Square business center
  • We currently have three labs (Visual Understanding, Multimodal Data Analysis, Machine Learning)
  • …and many projects on such topics as:
    • Generation of photorealistic human avatars
    • Point clouds-based 3D image and video synthesis
    • Techniques for image manipulation using generative networks
    • Training neural networks using Bayesian methods
    • Creation of multi-agent systems
    • Single-view and multi-view 3D reconstruction
    • Localization and navigation using 3D vision
    • Neural image-based rendering
    • And more!
  • Over the past three years, our researchers have published more than 30 papers at the world's best conferences on computer vision and machine learning, including CVPR, ICCV / ECCV, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, IROS, WACV, and others.
